context: this article will guide you on how to connect payever to your shopify shop and start offering your desired payment methods through one single integration.
response: this article will guide you on how to connect payever to your shopify shop and start offering your desired payment methods through one single integration.

context: please keep in mind that additional fees for the shopify channel might apply - please contact support@payever.de for further details.
response: please keep in mind that additional fees for the shopify channel might apply - please contact support@payever.de for further details.

context: step 1: register an account
response: step 1: register an account

context: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.
response: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.

context: step 2: configure payment options
response: step 2: configure payment options

context: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.
response: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.

context: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.
response: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.

context: then click on + add.
response: then click on + add.

context: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.
response: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.

context: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.
response: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.

context: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.
response: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.

context: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).
response: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).

context: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.
response: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.

context: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.
response: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.

context: step 3: configure channels
response: step 3: configure channels

context: select the channels tab in the checkout app.
response: select the channels tab in the checkout app.

context: then click on + add.
response: then click on + add.

context: select shopify from the list that now appears and click on install.
response: select shopify from the list that now appears and click on install.

context: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.
response: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.

context: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.
response: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.

context: once done, click close in the upper right corner.
response: once done, click close in the upper right corner.

context: step 4: link payment methods
response: step 4: link payment methods

context: now open the shopify channel again - you should see the following window, where under apps you can see a list with all payment methods.
response: now open the shopify channel again - you should see the following window, where under apps you can see a list with all payment methods.

context: if you click on a payment method, you will only integrate this specific payment method which is then listed in the shopify checkout as a single payment method with a corresponding name and logo. if you would like to integrate several payment methods in this way, simply repeat the process described below until you have added all the payment methods individually.
response: if you click on a payment method, you will only integrate this specific payment method which is then listed in the shopify checkout as a single payment method with a corresponding name and logo. if you would like to integrate several payment methods in this way, simply repeat the process described below until you have added all the payment methods individually.

context: please note that the payment methods that you integrate need to be set up according to step 2 of this guide, otherwise it will not be possible to process the payment in the checkout.
response: please note that the payment methods that you integrate need to be set up according to step 2 of this guide, otherwise it will not be possible to process the payment in the checkout.

context: once you click on the payment method you will be redirected to shopify where you can log in with your personal shopify credentials and select your shop.
response: once you click on the payment method you will be redirected to shopify where you can log in with your personal shopify credentials and select your shop.

context: now confirm that you agree to connect the payment method.
response: now confirm that you agree to connect the payment method.

context: next click on install app.
response: next click on install app.

context: then click the activate button at the bottom right. leave the enable test mode checkbox empty unless you want to complete some test transactions first (if so, you may refer to the test section in the end of this article).
response: then click the activate button at the bottom right. leave the enable test mode checkbox empty unless you want to complete some test transactions first (if so, you may refer to the test section in the end of this article).

context: next click on manage.
response: next click on manage.

context: this will take you to a page where you can insert the api keys that you generated inside payever at the end of step 3.
response: this will take you to a page where you can insert the api keys that you generated inside payever at the end of step 3.

context: by default the fields will contain our sandbox api credentials. if you first wish to test the payment method in sandbox, leave in the existing credentials. if you want to use the payment method in live, you will need to insert your own credentials from your payever account. don't forget to tick the field live mode when using the payment method in live.
response: by default the fields will contain our sandbox api credentials. if you first wish to test the payment method in sandbox, leave in the existing credentials. if you want to use the payment method in live, you will need to insert your own credentials from your payever account. don't forget to tick the field live mode when using the payment method in live.

context: finally click on save.
response: finally click on save.

context: under settings > payments you will ow be able to see all your installed payment methods.
response: under settings > payments you will ow be able to see all your installed payment methods.

context: testing the plugin: the test mode
response: testing the plugin: the test mode

context: would you like to test the plugin first? please activate the test mode. to do this, you must first go back to the settings and to the payments tab. next click on manage for the respective payment method.
response: would you like to test the plugin first? please activate the test mode. to do this, you must first go back to the settings and to the payments tab. next click on manage for the respective payment method.

context: please activate the test mode by ticking the enable test mode and enter our test data under manage, which you can find here, and click save. to have payments confirmed in test mode, please use the relevant stub data which you can find here.
response: please activate the test mode by ticking the enable test mode and enter our test data under manage, which you can find here, and click save. to have payments confirmed in test mode, please use the relevant stub data which you can find here.

context: now you can test the plugin without triggering a real transaction. we kindly ask you to test only in sandbox mode, since test transactions in live, even if you subsequently cancel them immediately, can have undesirable consequences (for example, if you test too often with your credit card it may be reported or blocked and if you submit multiple installment loan applications in your name this may worsen your credit score, etc.).
response: now you can test the plugin without triggering a real transaction. we kindly ask you to test only in sandbox mode, since test transactions in live, even if you subsequently cancel them immediately, can have undesirable consequences (for example, if you test too often with your credit card it may be reported or blocked and if you submit multiple installment loan applications in your name this may worsen your credit score, etc.).

context: if you want to go live, please do not forget to switch off the test mode, remove the test data and instead enter your own data from your payever account, and then click save again.
response: if you want to go live, please do not forget to switch off the test mode, remove the test data and instead enter your own data from your payever account, and then click save again.

context: once step 4 is completed, the minimum technical requirements to process a payment are met, meaning payments can now be processed successfully with most payment service providers (psps).
response: once step 4 is completed, the minimum technical requirements to process a payment are met, meaning payments can now be processed successfully with most payment service providers (psps).

context: however, there are some providers (mostly zinia and santander) who additionally require details about the items contained in the customer's shopping cart. since this data is unfortunately not provided as part of shopify's normal payment interface, a separate app must be installed in order to receive this data:
response: however, there are some providers (mostly zinia and santander) who additionally require details about the items contained in the customer's shopping cart. since this data is unfortunately not provided as part of shopify's normal payment interface, a separate app must be installed in order to receive this data:

context: if you use a payment option from zinia or santander, please install the above app and enter the same api keys there as before in step 3:
response: if you use a payment option from zinia or santander, please install the above app and enter the same api keys there as before in step 3:

context: then select the respective mode (if you would like to accept real payments in live/production mode, please tick "live mode") and save the settings.
response: then select the respective mode (if you would like to accept real payments in live/production mode, please tick "live mode") and save the settings.

context: after the integration: statuses and their meaning
response: after the integration: statuses and their meaning

context: in general, our plugins are designed so that all actions available in the payever account can also be initiated from your magento backend. as a rule, you do not need to log into your payever account to find out the status of a payment or to cancel a payment, for example!
response: in general, our plugins are designed so that all actions available in the payever account can also be initiated from your magento backend. as a rule, you do not need to log into your payever account to find out the status of a payment or to cancel a payment, for example!

context: status messages
response: status messages

context: the following table explains how status messages from payever payments are to be interpreted in shopify. we recommend reading this carefully and, if necessary, also sharing it with other people in your company who work with your shopify shop or with order processing. payever status means the status reports that you see in your payever account.
response: the following table explains how status messages from payever payments are to be interpreted in shopify. we recommend reading this carefully and, if necessary, also sharing it with other people in your company who work with your shopify shop or with order processing. payever status means the status reports that you see in your payever account.

context: you will see this status when you have a failed transaction, or when the payment service provider has declined the customer (note that most transactions that get declined by the psp right away don't create an order in shopify at all, you'll only see the declined transaction as an order in shopify if the rejection came in later in the process). the shopify status "expired" is only given out if the previous status was "pending" in shopify
response: you will see this status when you have a failed transaction, or when the payment service provider has declined the customer (note that most transactions that get declined by the psp right away don't create an order in shopify at all, you'll only see the declined transaction as an order in shopify if the rejection came in later in the process). the shopify status "expired" is only given out if the previous status was "pending" in shopify

context: check order details (execute/markup/capture)
response: check order details (execute/markup/capture)

context: in the left navigation bar, look for the orders tab and select the order you would like to view.
response: in the left navigation bar, look for the orders tab and select the order you would like to view.

context: in the next step you can 1. view your order details, 2. mark the order as fulfilled and 3. if you have selected in your shop to capture manually, capture the payment.
response: in the next step you can 1. view your order details, 2. mark the order as fulfilled and 3. if you have selected in your shop to capture manually, capture the payment.

context: cancellations and refunds
response: cancellations and refunds

context: if you want to refund a transaction, please open the order details of the relevant order (orders > affected order). in the top navigation bar, look for the refund tab.
response: if you want to refund a transaction, please open the order details of the relevant order (orders > affected order). in the top navigation bar, look for the refund tab.

context: here you can decide which and how many products you want to refund and click on the green button at the bottom right to have the selected amount refunded.
response: here you can decide which and how many products you want to refund and click on the green button at the bottom right to have the selected amount refunded.

context: please note however that not all of our payment methods have an automatic cancellation function: installment loans can only be canceled via payever / shopify before the goods are shipped to the customer (if you'd like to cancel the order after the goods are shipped then you need to get in touch with santander directly). direct bank transfers and direct debits can only be reimbursed from your bank account via a transfer to the customer.
response: please note however that not all of our payment methods have an automatic cancellation function: installment loans can only be canceled via payever / shopify before the goods are shipped to the customer (if you'd like to cancel the order after the goods are shipped then you need to get in touch with santander directly). direct bank transfers and direct debits can only be reimbursed from your bank account via a transfer to the customer.

context: step 1: register an account
response: step 1: register an account

context: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.
response: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.

context: step 2: configure payment options
response: step 2: configure payment options

context: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.
response: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.

context: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.
response: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.

context: then click on + add.
response: then click on + add.

context: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.
response: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.

context: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.
response: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.

context: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.
response: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.

context: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).
response: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).

context: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.
response: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.

context: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.
response: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.

context: step 3: configure channels
response: step 3: configure channels

context: select the channels tab in the checkout app.
response: select the channels tab in the checkout app.

context: click + add.
response: click + add.

context: select woocommerce from the list that now appears and click on install.
response: select woocommerce from the list that now appears and click on install.

context: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.
response: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.

context: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.
response: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.

context: step 4: install plugin
response: step 4: install plugin

context: search for the payever plugin on the wordpress plugin website and install it to your shop.
response: search for the payever plugin on the wordpress plugin website and install it to your shop.

context: step 5: configure login
response: step 5: configure login

context: log into your wordpress backend and open the payever settings (click on woocommerce in the navigation bar on the left side of the screen, then click on settings and choose the tab payever).
response: log into your wordpress backend and open the payever settings (click on woocommerce in the navigation bar on the left side of the screen, then click on settings and choose the tab payever).

context: fill in the business-uuid and api keys and that you generated in your payever account (see step 3) and set the mode to live (unless you want to test first - in that case please refer to the section on testing).
response: fill in the business-uuid and api keys and that you generated in your payever account (see step 3) and set the mode to live (unless you want to test first - in that case please refer to the section on testing).

context: make sure that you select the option completed for shipped status. this setting is required so that the payments (especially installments and invoice) are automatically captured without you having to manually handle this.
response: make sure that you select the option completed for shipped status. this setting is required so that the payments (especially installments and invoice) are automatically captured without you having to manually handle this.

context: you can also set whether you want to display the name, icon and description of the payment method (especially for the latter, please make sure that you enter a meaningful description text in step 6).
response: you can also set whether you want to display the name, icon and description of the payment method (especially for the latter, please make sure that you enter a meaningful description text in step 6).

context: with redirect to payever, we recommend that you leave the box empty - then the checkout will be displayed directly within an iframe on your website and the customer does not have to be redirected to a new page.
response: with redirect to payever, we recommend that you leave the box empty - then the checkout will be displayed directly within an iframe on your website and the customer does not have to be redirected to a new page.

context: now save your settings (by clicking on save changes) and synchronize them (by clicking on synchronize).
response: now save your settings (by clicking on save changes) and synchronize them (by clicking on synchronize).

context: step 6: configure payment methods
response: step 6: configure payment methods

context: click on woocommerce in the navigation bar at the left side of the screen, then choose settings and payments. check whether all payment methods that are also activated in your payever account and that you want to offer to your customers are activated here. by clicking on set up / manage you can also change the individual settings for each payment option.
response: click on woocommerce in the navigation bar at the left side of the screen, then choose settings and payments. check whether all payment methods that are also activated in your payever account and that you want to offer to your customers are activated here. by clicking on set up / manage you can also change the individual settings for each payment option.

context: enable those options that you have activated in your payever account.
response: enable those options that you have activated in your payever account.

context: plesae make sure the payment option is enabled (checkbox enable is ticked). assign a name and description to be shown to the customer in your checkout (only necessary if you have decided to show descriptions in your plugin settings).
response: plesae make sure the payment option is enabled (checkbox enable is ticked). assign a name and description to be shown to the customer in your checkout (only necessary if you have decided to show descriptions in your plugin settings).

context: note that the option merchant covers fee is overpowered by the settings in your payever account (if you have selected in the settings of this payment option in your payever account that you as the merchant will cover the costs, leaving this checkbox here unticked will not lead to the customer paying the fees!).
response: note that the option merchant covers fee is overpowered by the settings in your payever account (if you have selected in the settings of this payment option in your payever account that you as the merchant will cover the costs, leaving this checkbox here unticked will not lead to the customer paying the fees!).

context: use the settings minimum order total and maximum order total to define from which up to which amount the payment option shall appear in your checkout. please enter the minimum and maximum amount that you have agreed upon with the payment provider here (provided any such minimum and /or maximum values exist for said payment option). you may reduce the the maximum or increase the minimum by yourself, but you should not enter a lower minimum or higher maximum (this would lead for the payment option to show in the checkout outside the limits set by the psp, but also to an error message or decline once the customer selected the option and is trying to pay).
response: use the settings minimum order total and maximum order total to define from which up to which amount the payment option shall appear in your checkout. please enter the minimum and maximum amount that you have agreed upon with the payment provider here (provided any such minimum and /or maximum values exist for said payment option). you may reduce the the maximum or increase the minimum by yourself, but you should not enter a lower minimum or higher maximum (this would lead for the payment option to show in the checkout outside the limits set by the psp, but also to an error message or decline once the customer selected the option and is trying to pay).

context: before leaving these settings, make sure to save any changes by clicking on save changes.
response: before leaving these settings, make sure to save any changes by clicking on save changes.

context: video summary
response: video summary

context: sandbox mode: testing the plug
response: sandbox mode: testing the plug

context: would you like to test the plugin and the payment options before you go live? no problem - there is the so-called sandbox mode, in which transactions can be carried out without actual payment processing. to activate sandbox mode, change the mode to sandbox in the settings of the payever plugin and automatically apply our test data by clicking on set up sandbox api keys. alternatively you may fill in the test credentials (business uuid, client secret, client id) provided here: https://docs.payever.org/resources/de/test-credentials
response: would you like to test the plugin and the payment options before you go live? no problem - there is the so-called sandbox mode, in which transactions can be carried out without actual payment processing. to activate sandbox mode, change the mode to sandbox in the settings of the payever plugin and automatically apply our test data by clicking on set up sandbox api keys. alternatively you may fill in the test credentials (business uuid, client secret, client id) provided here: https://docs.payever.org/resources/de/test-credentials

context: once you have changed the credentials and mode, click save changes and then synchronise to make your changes effective. you are now in sandbox mode!
response: once you have changed the credentials and mode, click save changes and then synchronise to make your changes effective. you are now in sandbox mode!

context: in the sandbox mode you are not connected to your own payever account, but to our general test account - which is why you can now see all available payment methods here, not just those that you have activated in your live payever account.
response: in the sandbox mode you are not connected to your own payever account, but to our general test account - which is why you can now see all available payment methods here, not just those that you have activated in your live payever account.

context: to test the various payment statuses in the sandbox mode, please use the relevant stub data which you can find here.
response: to test the various payment statuses in the sandbox mode, please use the relevant stub data which you can find here.

context: now you can test the plugin without triggering a real transaction. we kindly ask you to test only in the sandbox mode, since test transactions in live mode, even if they are subsequently canceled, can have undesirable consequences (for example, if you test too often with your credit card it may be reported and blocked or if you submit multiple installment loan applications in your name it can worsen your credit score, etc.).
response: now you can test the plugin without triggering a real transaction. we kindly ask you to test only in the sandbox mode, since test transactions in live mode, even if they are subsequently canceled, can have undesirable consequences (for example, if you test too often with your credit card it may be reported and blocked or if you submit multiple installment loan applications in your name it can worsen your credit score, etc.).

context: when you're done testing and want to go live:
response: when you're done testing and want to go live:

context: after the integration: how to process payment with paypal
response: after the integration: how to process payment with paypal

context: in general, our plugins are designed so that all actions available in the payever account can also be initiated from your woocommerce backend. as a rule, you do not need to log into your payever account to find out about the status of a payment or to cancel a payment, for example.
response: in general, our plugins are designed so that all actions available in the payever account can also be initiated from your woocommerce backend. as a rule, you do not need to log into your payever account to find out about the status of a payment or to cancel a payment, for example.

context: status reports - the payment status on hold / pending payment usually only occurs with the installment loan and means that the payment is not yet complete (customer still has to go through an identification process and / or submit missing documents). if you see this status, please wait and do not ship the goods to the customer yet. the status processing means that the payment was successful and complete - in this case you can safely ship the goods to your customer.
response: status reports - the payment status on hold / pending payment usually only occurs with the installment loan and means that the payment is not yet complete (customer still has to go through an identification process and / or submit missing documents). if you see this status, please wait and do not ship the goods to the customer yet. the status processing means that the payment was successful and complete - in this case you can safely ship the goods to your customer.

context: rejected transactions are displayed with " failed/declined" in the payever account and will be displayed as failed/cancelled with the status update in the woocommerce backend.
response: rejected transactions are displayed with " failed/declined" in the payever account and will be displayed as failed/cancelled with the status update in the woocommerce backend.

context: capture / shipping goods - please note that for some of our payment methods (e.g. invoice and installments, as well as paypal and credit card if you have decided to switch off automatic capture in the settings) you have to report the shipping of goods if order to fully process the payment. you do not have to do this manually in your payever account however, as you can simply set the status of the affected order to completed after the goods have been shipped and and click update in woocommerce (this automatically informs the respective payment provider, and you do not need to do anything else). a green shipped successfully message from payever should now appear on the right-hand side of your screen. if you see this you can be sure that the process was successful. attention: the automatic shipping notification from woocommerce to payever only works if you have saved the shipped status as described in step 5!
response: capture / shipping goods - please note that for some of our payment methods (e.g. invoice and installments, as well as paypal and credit card if you have decided to switch off automatic capture in the settings) you have to report the shipping of goods if order to fully process the payment. you do not have to do this manually in your payever account however, as you can simply set the status of the affected order to completed after the goods have been shipped and and click update in woocommerce (this automatically informs the respective payment provider, and you do not need to do anything else). a green shipped successfully message from payever should now appear on the right-hand side of your screen. if you see this you can be sure that the process was successful. attention: the automatic shipping notification from woocommerce to payever only works if you have saved the shipped status as described in step 5!

context: cancellations and refunds - to partially or fully refund a transaction, please open the order details and click the refund button below the list of ordered products.
response: cancellations and refunds - to partially or fully refund a transaction, please open the order details and click the refund button below the list of ordered products.

context: then choose which products you want to refund. now press the blue button at the bottom right.
response: then choose which products you want to refund. now press the blue button at the bottom right.

context: a green refunded success message from payever should now appear on the right-hand side of your screen. if you see this you can be sure that the process was successful.
response: a green refunded success message from payever should now appear on the right-hand side of your screen. if you see this you can be sure that the process was successful.

context: please note though that not all of our payment methods have an automatic cancellation function: direct bank transfers and direct debit payments can only be refunded from your bank account via a manual transfer to the customer.
response: please note though that not all of our payment methods have an automatic cancellation function: direct bank transfers and direct debit payments can only be refunded from your bank account via a manual transfer to the customer.

context: any further questions or problems?
response: any further questions or problems?

context: you can reach our support from monday to friday between 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. at support@payever.de
response: you can reach our support from monday to friday between 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. at support@payever.de

context: please let us know in your message which shop system and plugin version you are using, which shop (url and / or email address with which you are registered with us) your request is concerning and which error message or issue you are facing - so we can process your request faster!

context: save the settings (click on save config on the right) then synchronize the payment methods in the payment app section by clicking on the button synchronize.
response: save the settings (click on save config on the right) then synchronize the payment methods in the payment app section by clicking on the button synchronize.

context: after synchronization, check whether the payment options activated in your magento backend are the same as those that are activated in your payever account, and that are the payment options you wish to offer to your customers. by clicking on the arrow next to the payment methods, you can also change the individual settings for each payment option (such as description, title and min/max order totals).
response: after synchronization, check whether the payment options activated in your magento backend are the same as those that are activated in your payever account, and that are the payment options you wish to offer to your customers. by clicking on the arrow next to the payment methods, you can also change the individual settings for each payment option (such as description, title and min/max order totals).

context: before leaving these settings, make sure to save any changes by clicking on save config.
response: before leaving these settings, make sure to save any changes by clicking on save config.

context: video summary
response: video summary

context: testing mode /sandbox
response: testing mode /sandbox

context: would you like to test the plugin and the payment options before you go live? no problem - you can do so in staging/sandbox mode, since in this mode none of the transactions will result in an actual payment. to activate staging/sandbox mode, set mode to sandbox in the plugin settings and click on restore api keys to have the test credentials show up automatically. alternatively, manually fill in the test credentials (business uuid, client secret, client id) provided here: https://docs.payever.org/resources/de/test-credentials
response: would you like to test the plugin and the payment options before you go live? no problem - you can do so in staging/sandbox mode, since in this mode none of the transactions will result in an actual payment. to activate staging/sandbox mode, set mode to sandbox in the plugin settings and click on restore api keys to have the test credentials show up automatically. alternatively, manually fill in the test credentials (business uuid, client secret, client id) provided here: https://docs.payever.org/resources/de/test-credentials

context: in the sandbox mode you are not connected to your own payever account, but to our general test account - which is why you can now see all available payment methods here, not just those that you have activated in your live payever account.
response: in the sandbox mode you are not connected to your own payever account, but to our general test account - which is why you can now see all available payment methods here, not just those that you have activated in your live payever account.

context: to test the various payment statuses in the sandbox mode, please use the relevant stub data which you can find here.
response: to test the various payment statuses in the sandbox mode, please use the relevant stub data which you can find here.

context: now you can test the plugin without triggering a real transaction. we kindly ask you to test only in the sandbox mode, since test transactions in live mode, even if they are subsequently canceled, can have undesirable consequences (for example, if you test too often with your credit card, it may be reported and blocked or if you submit multiple installment loan applications in your name it can worsen your credit score, etc.).
response: now you can test the plugin without triggering a real transaction. we kindly ask you to test only in the sandbox mode, since test transactions in live mode, even if they are subsequently canceled, can have undesirable consequences (for example, if you test too often with your credit card, it may be reported and blocked or if you submit multiple installment loan applications in your name it can worsen your credit score, etc.).

context: when you're done testing and want to go live:
response: when you're done testing and want to go live:

context: after the integration: how to handle payments
response: after the integration: how to handle payments

context: in general, our plugins are designed such that all actions available in the payever account can also be initiated from your magento backend. as a rule of thumb, you usually do not need to log into your payever account to find out about the status of a payment or e.g. cancel a payment!
response: in general, our plugins are designed such that all actions available in the payever account can also be initiated from your magento backend. as a rule of thumb, you usually do not need to log into your payever account to find out about the status of a payment or e.g. cancel a payment!

context: status notifications - the payment status in in progress usually occurs only for the payment option installment loan and means that the payment is not yet complete (customer has to go through an identification process and / or submit documents later). if you see this status, please wait and do not send the goods yet. the status accepted means that the payment has been successful and is complete - in this case you can send the goods. the status closed means that the payment has failed, has been declined or canceled by you (in this status, please do not send any goods either).
response: status notifications - the payment status in in progress usually occurs only for the payment option installment loan and means that the payment is not yet complete (customer has to go through an identification process and / or submit documents later). if you see this status, please wait and do not send the goods yet. the status accepted means that the payment has been successful and is complete - in this case you can send the goods. the status closed means that the payment has failed, has been declined or canceled by you (in this status, please do not send any goods either).

context: capture/ shipping goods - please note that some payment options (invoice, factoring und installments always, for paypal and creditcard it depends on your settings) require you do capture the transaction/ report that you have shipped the order. to do this, please open the order details (> sales> orders> click on view for the relevant transaction). click on ship in the detailed view of the order at the top right.
response: capture/ shipping goods - please note that some payment options (invoice, factoring und installments always, for paypal and creditcard it depends on your settings) require you do capture the transaction/ report that you have shipped the order. to do this, please open the order details (> sales> orders> click on view for the relevant transaction). click on ship in the detailed view of the order at the top right.

context: on the new shipment ... page that now opens, there is the submit shipment button at the bottom right, which triggers the dispatch notification.
response: on the new shipment ... page that now opens, there is the submit shipment button at the bottom right, which triggers the dispatch notification.

context: after clicking this, you will see the success message below and the magento-status will update to completed.
response: after clicking this, you will see the success message below and the magento-status will update to completed.

context: cancellations and refunds - if you want to refund a transaction, please open the order details (> sales> invoices> click on "view" for the relevant transaction). now click on credit memo at the top right in the detailed view of the order.
response: cancellations and refunds - if you want to refund a transaction, please open the order details (> sales> invoices> click on "view" for the relevant transaction). now click on credit memo at the top right in the detailed view of the order.

context: on the new credit memo ... page that now opens, the refund button is located at the bottom right (attention, not refund offline!), which triggers the cancellation at payever. if you only want to cancel part of the order, first enter "0" as the quantity for the item that is to be canceled, click update quantities and then click refund.
response: on the new credit memo ... page that now opens, the refund button is located at the bottom right (attention, not refund offline!), which triggers the cancellation at payever. if you only want to cancel part of the order, first enter "0" as the quantity for the item that is to be canceled, click update quantities and then click refund.

context: please note that not al our payment options have an automated cancelation function: santander installments germany allows automated canceling only before shipping, after that you'd need to write an emails to cfs-abrechnung@santander.de; direktuberweisungen/instant payments and direct debit transactions can only be refunded by manually transferring the money back to your customers bank account directly from yours.
response: please note that not al our payment options have an automated cancelation function: santander installments germany allows automated canceling only before shipping, after that you'd need to write an emails to cfs-abrechnung@santander.de; direktuberweisungen/instant payments and direct debit transactions can only be refunded by manually transferring the money back to your customers bank account directly from yours.

context: are you using magento 1? please switch to this manual.
response: are you using magento 1? please switch to this manual.

context: step 1: register an account
response: step 1: register an account

context: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.
response: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.

context: step 2: configure payment options
response: step 2: configure payment options

context: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.
response: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.

context: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.
response: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.

context: then click on + add.
response: then click on + add.

context: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.
response: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.

context: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.
response: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.

context: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.
response: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.

context: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).
response: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).

context: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.
response: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.

context: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.
response: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.

context: step 3: configure channels
response: step 3: configure channels

context: select the channels tab in the checkout app.
response: select the channels tab in the checkout app.

context: click + add.
response: click + add.

context: select magento from the list that now appears and click on install.
response: select magento from the list that now appears and click on install.

context: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.
response: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.

context: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.
response: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.

context: step 4: install magento plugin
response: step 4: install magento plugin

context: how you best install your plugin also depends on how you installed magento 2. if you installed magento 2 via cli, you must also install the plugin via cli, if you installed magento 2 via admin, you have the free choice of whether you would prefer to install via cli or admin.
response: how you best install your plugin also depends on how you installed magento 2. if you installed magento 2 via cli, you must also install the plugin via cli, if you installed magento 2 via admin, you have the free choice of whether you would prefer to install via cli or admin.

context: instructions on how to install plugins via cli can be found here on magento's website. for installation using admin please follow these instructions.
response: instructions on how to install plugins via cli can be found here on magento's website. for installation using admin please follow these instructions.

context: after installing the payever plugin in one way or another, please return to this guide and proceed with step 5 (if you don't use the hyva theme).
response: after installing the payever plugin in one way or another, please return to this guide and proceed with step 5 (if you don't use the hyva theme).

context: if you use the hyva theme...
response: if you use the hyva theme...

context: ...please additionally install hyva in our connect-app and download the plugin (1.0.0) by following these steps:
response: ...please additionally install hyva in our connect-app and download the plugin (1.0.0) by following these steps:

context: click on connect-app on your dashboard:
response: click on connect-app on your dashboard:

context: choose shopsystems in the navigation on the left side, search for hyva and click install:
response: choose shopsystems in the navigation on the left side, search for hyva and click install:

context: in the pop up please click on open:
response: in the pop up please click on open:

context: in the next pop up please download plugin (1.0.0) by clicking on download:
response: in the next pop up please download plugin (1.0.0) by clicking on download:

context: note: do not create api keys for hyva, they are not needed at any time!
response: note: do not create api keys for hyva, they are not needed at any time!

context: afterwards please click done in the top right corner of the pop up. now you can continue with the configuration of magento (with step 5).
response: afterwards please click done in the top right corner of the pop up. now you can continue with the configuration of magento (with step 5).

context: step 5: configure the magento plugin
response: step 5: configure the magento plugin

context: to configure the plugin, please go to stores > configuration > sales > payment methods and click on configure under payever.
response: to configure the plugin, please go to stores > configuration > sales > payment methods and click on configure under payever.

context: now you need to configure some settings:
response: now you need to configure some settings:

context: environment: please select live (unless you want to do some test transactions first, in this case please select sandbox - more information can be found at the end of this manual).
response: environment: please select live (unless you want to do some test transactions first, in this case please select sandbox - more information can be found at the end of this manual).

context: if you have set up everything as desired, please click save config and then synchronize payment methods.
response: if you have set up everything as desired, please click save config and then synchronize payment methods.

context: step 6: configure payment methods
response: step 6: configure payment methods

context: you can then change the settings for the individual payment methods. to do this, scroll down until you find the payment options listed below the synchronize payment methods button.
response: you can then change the settings for the individual payment methods. to do this, scroll down until you find the payment options listed below the synchronize payment methods button.

context: when you have configured all payment methods, please do not forget to click save config again!
response: when you have configured all payment methods, please do not forget to click save config again!

context: step 7: clear cache
response: step 7: clear cache

context: after saving the configurations you will probably notice the following message (in yellow) at the top of the page:
response: after saving the configurations you will probably notice the following message (in yellow) at the top of the page:

context: please do not ignore this message, but follow the advice and click on the link in the warning message. this will take you to the cache management page.
response: please do not ignore this message, but follow the advice and click on the link in the warning message. this will take you to the cache management page.

context: put a check mark next to configuration and page cache and click submit. this step is necessary so that you can then see your changes (e.g. to the names and description texts of the payment methods) in the front end of your shop!
response: put a check mark next to configuration and page cache and click submit. this step is necessary so that you can then see your changes (e.g. to the names and description texts of the payment methods) in the front end of your shop!

context: step 8: check front-end
response: step 8: check front-end

context: now you can check whether the payment methods are displayed as desired (including the payment options logo, name and description) and whether the forwarding to payever works. if everything is correct, the result should look something like this (screenshot shows iframe mode):
response: now you can check whether the payment methods are displayed as desired (including the payment options logo, name and description) and whether the forwarding to payever works. if everything is correct, the result should look something like this (screenshot shows iframe mode):

context: however, please do not make any payments as long as you are in live mode, as this will result in a real transaction and therefore will incur fees. if you want to test transaction completion and processing, please follow the instructions in the next paragraph, and remember too switch to sandbox mode.

context: would you like to test the plugin first? please activate sandbox mode under environment and click on the button use sandbox api key. now save your configurations (save configs) and click on synchronize payment methods. in sandbox mode you are not connected to your own payever account, but to our general test account - which is why you can now see all available payment methods here, not just those that you have activated in your own payever account.

context: 1.) account configuration
response: 1.) account configuration

context: step 1: register an account
response: step 1: register an account

context: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.
response: create your free payever account here, or login in case you already have one.

context: step 2: configure payment options
response: step 2: configure payment options

context: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.
response: in order to configure your payment options, first open the checkout app. to do this, either click on the checkout symbol under business apps or click on the manage or open button on the checkout section.

context: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.
response: you can find the payment methods tab in the navigation bar on the left.

context: then click on + add.
response: then click on + add.

context: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.
response: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.

context: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.
response: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.

context: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.
response: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.

context: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).
response: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).

context: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.
response: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.

context: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.
response: after you have connected the payment methods, you can make changes to the settings of the specific payment method. please refer to our documentation for the specific payment method for more information, which you can find here.

context: step 3: configure channels
response: step 3: configure channels

context: select the channels tab in the checkout app.
response: select the channels tab in the checkout app.

context: click + add.
response: click + add.

context: select commercetools from the list that now appears and click on install.
response: select commercetools from the list that now appears and click on install.

context: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.
response: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.

context: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the added connection that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.
response: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the added connection that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.

context: select credentials and click on add connection. enter a name of your choice and fill out your commercetools project key, client id and secret. the copied client id, secret and business uuid from the previous step, can be inserted in the payever related fields. choose your callback urls to decide the customer landing pages for specific payment scenarios and select when to create an order commercetools. afterwards, click on connect and you see your added connection.
response: select credentials and click on add connection. enter a name of your choice and fill out your commercetools project key, client id and secret. the copied client id, secret and business uuid from the previous step, can be inserted in the payever related fields. choose your callback urls to decide the customer landing pages for specific payment scenarios and select when to create an order commercetools. afterwards, click on connect and you see your added connection.

context: 2.) technical integration guide
response: 2.) technical integration guide

context: in order to use the payever gateway integration with commercetools, please follow this integration guide to make sure your implementation and process works as needed.
response: in order to use the payever gateway integration with commercetools, please follow this integration guide to make sure your implementation and process works as needed.

context: terms used in this guide:
response: terms used in this guide:

context: roughly summarised, this manual will guide you through the following steps:
response: roughly summarised, this manual will guide you through the following steps:

context: the merchant server should execute the following validations:
response: the merchant server should execute the following validations:

context: validate cart state - check if current cart has been ordered already/ if the cart already has status "ordered" (cart.cartstate = ordered). this might happen if the cart has been already ordered in a different tab (edge case) or by an optional asynchronous process like commercetools-payment-to-order-processor job.
response: validate cart state - check if current cart has been ordered already/ if the cart already has status "ordered" (cart.cartstate = ordered). this might happen if the cart has been already ordered in a different tab (edge case) or by an optional asynchronous process like commercetools-payment-to-order-processor job.

context: recalculate cart -execute cart recalculate to ensure that cart totals are always up-to-date, and that time-limited discounts are eventually removed from the cart (discounts are validated on re-calculate and order creation only).
response: recalculate cart -execute cart recalculate to ensure that cart totals are always up-to-date, and that time-limited discounts are eventually removed from the cart (discounts are validated on re-calculate and order creation only).

context: validate payment - there must be at least one commercetools payment object of type payever (`payment.paymentmethodinfo.paymentinterface = ctp-payever-integration`).
response: validate payment - there must be at least one commercetools payment object of type payever (`payment.paymentmethodinfo.paymentinterface = ctp-payever-integration`).

context: validate payment transaction - cart's payment counts as successful if there is at least one payment object with successful transaction state (payment.transaction.state=success) and transaction type authorization or charge.
response: validate payment transaction - cart's payment counts as successful if there is at least one payment object with successful transaction state (payment.transaction.state=success) and transaction type authorization or charge.

context: before the actual payment process, commercetools payment resource needs to be created by the merchant server.
response: before the actual payment process, commercetools payment resource needs to be created by the merchant server.

context: in the commercetools platform, the payment merely represents a container of the current state of receiving and/or refunding money. the actual financial process is performed behind the scenes by the extension module which processes commercetools payment payload supplied by the merchant server and exchanges it with payever api.
response: in the commercetools platform, the payment merely represents a container of the current state of receiving and/or refunding money. the actual financial process is performed behind the scenes by the extension module which processes commercetools payment payload supplied by the merchant server and exchanges it with payever api.

context: the commercetools payment does not contain all the required payever specific fields by default, so those have to be set up as custom fields via a payment method-specific payment type.
response: the commercetools payment does not contain all the required payever specific fields by default, so those have to be set up as custom fields via a payment method-specific payment type.

response: step 3 (optional): get available payment methods

context: when your shopper is ready to pay, you may request through the integration a list of the available payment methods based on the transaction details (like amount, country, and currency).
response: when your shopper is ready to pay, you may request through the integration a list of the available payment methods based on the transaction details (like amount, country, and currency).

context: this step is optional but payever recommends to use it so that you don't need to define the different requirements such as minimum and maximum amount, country of residence, etc. on your end and the merchant server will always display the latest list of payment methods.
response: this step is optional but payever recommends to use it so that you don't need to define the different requirements such as minimum and maximum amount, country of residence, etc. on your end and the merchant server will always display the latest list of payment methods.

context: you don't necessarily need to perform this step upon every single purchase though - it should usually be enough to request this e.g. once a day and then cache the resulting list and reuse it throughout the next 24h.
response: you don't necessarily need to perform this step upon every single purchase though - it should usually be enough to request this e.g. once a day and then cache the resulting list and reuse it throughout the next 24h.

response: to get available payment methods via our integration, you need to set the getpaymentmethodsrequest custom field to your existing commercetools payment, or create a payment right away with the custom fieldset.

response: if you don't have a payment object, check creating a new commercetools payment and set getpaymentmethodsrequest custom field together with other required fields.

context: step 5: order actions (capture, cancel, refund)
response: step 5: order actions (capture, cancel, refund)

context: unless your payment options don't require capture (e.g. instant payment, direct debit) or they require capture, but you have enabled "autocapture upon approval" in the payment option settings of your payever account, you will need to actively capture the payments once the corresponding orders got fulfilled.
response: unless your payment options don't require capture (e.g. instant payment, direct debit) or they require capture, but you have enabled "autocapture upon approval" in the payment option settings of your payever account, you will need to actively capture the payments once the corresponding orders got fulfilled.

context: generally speaking, payever is listening to orderstatechanged updates from commercetools and will update the payment accordingly if an order gets shipped or cancelled - so provided you have enabled project messages in developer settings (this is a prerequisite, if the messages are deactivated it won't work), the payment will be automatically captured in full when the order state updated to "shipped", and it will be automatically cancelled in full when the order state is updated to "cancelled". you don't need to implement anything in addition or make any additional request, it will happen automatically once the project messages are enabled.
response: generally speaking, payever is listening to orderstatechanged updates from commercetools and will update the payment accordingly if an order gets shipped or cancelled - so provided you have enabled project messages in developer settings (this is a prerequisite, if the messages are deactivated it won't work), the payment will be automatically captured in full when the order state updated to "shipped", and it will be automatically cancelled in full when the order state is updated to "cancelled". you don't need to implement anything in addition or make any additional request, it will happen automatically once the project messages are enabled.

context: if you would like to make partial actions as well though (partial capture, partial refund, partial cancellation), you will need to implement a request for this. please refer to the description below in case this is relevant for you.
response: if you would like to make partial actions as well though (partial capture, partial refund, partial cancellation), you will need to implement a request for this. please refer to the description below in case this is relevant for you.

response: capture (shipping goods)

response: to capture a payment, add a transaction with type 'charge' and state 'initial' to the commercetools payment as shown in the example below.

context: refund
response: refund

context: if you want to refund your customer, for example when they returned an item, you need to make a refund request.
response: if you want to refund your customer, for example when they returned an item, you need to make a refund request.

context: prerequisites - it is required that the payment has a transaction of type authorization and state success. from the authorized transaction, the value in the interactionid field is being used as the paymentid in the refund request to payever.
response: prerequisites - it is required that the payment has a transaction of type authorization and state success. from the authorized transaction, the value in the interactionid field is being used as the paymentid in the refund request to payever.

context: to make a (partial) refund, add at least one transaction with type refund and state initial to the commercetools payment. it is possible to add multiple refund transactions and all of them will be processed in parallel.
response: to make a (partial) refund, add at least one transaction with type refund and state initial to the commercetools payment. it is possible to add multiple refund transactions and all of them will be processed in parallel.

context: requests and response between payever and the extension module are being stored in the interfaceinteraction field of the payment with type refund.
response: requests and response between payever and the extension module are being stored in the interfaceinteraction field of the payment with type refund.

response: the commercetools payment representation after a successful refund:

context: please note - don't add too many refund transactions at the same time because, since the api extension endpoint has a time limit. by adding too many transactions at once, the extension module will need more time to process all of them and this could lead to timeouts.
response: please note - don't add too many refund transactions at the same time because, since the api extension endpoint has a time limit. by adding too many transactions at once, the extension module will need more time to process all of them and this could lead to timeouts.

context: additional information about our refund api can be found in our api documentation.
response: additional information about our refund api can be found in our api documentation.

context: cancel
response: cancel

context: if you have authorised a payment but won't capture it (e.g. because the item is not in stock), you should cancel the open authorisation. if the payment has already been captured, you need to #refund instead.
response: if you have authorised a payment but won't capture it (e.g. because the item is not in stock), you should cancel the open authorisation. if the payment has already been captured, you need to #refund instead.

response: in order to be able to make a cancellation, the payment must have an authorization transaction with state success. the value in the interactionid field of this authorisation transaction will be used as paymentid for the payever cancel request.

context: to make a cancellation, add a transaction with type cancelauthorization and state initial to the commercetools payment.
response: to make a cancellation, add a transaction with type cancelauthorization and state initial to the commercetools payment.

context: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.
response: now a list of different payment methods appears, from which you can select as needed. to do this, click on install.

response: once you have installed the payment channel, click on open and a new page will open, the structure of which will vary depending on the payment method chosen.

context: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.
response: with the payment methods credit card, direct debit, sofortuberweisung and paypal just click the connect button and you will be forwarded to the respective payment provider. there you connect your existing account or create a new one.

context: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).
response: for the payment methods installments, invoice, factoring and direct bank transfer you have to enter the access data that you have received from santander and then click on connect (if you have not been in touch with santander before, please contact support@payever.de).

context: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.
response: regardless of the payment method, please make sure that you always enter your access data in the default tab.

response: now you need to click open so that you can generate the api keys in the next step.

context: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.
response: select api keys and click on + add. enter a name of your choice and click on generate. afterwards, click on the plus icon (+) and you see the credentials that you have to insert into the shop system that you use for your online business (i.e., client id, client secret, business uuid). please copy these to your clipboard.

context: finally, click on the downloads tab (above the api key) and download the latest version of our plugin from the list that now opens (zip file).
response: finally, click on the downloads tab (above the api key) and download the latest version of our plugin from the list that now opens (zip file).
